attributes.action: Don’t end the scheme that houses homeless people through the pandemic
attributes.additional_details: Shelter is a basic human right and with homelessness rocketing due to the crashing economy the homeless should not be left behind during this lockdown, with the drop in temperature causing them to be at higher risk of mortality if they were to be infected.
attributes.background: The “everyone in” scheme that housed homeless people through the first lockdown has quietly been scrapped, which is deplorable in light of the drop in temperatures and the increased severity of the pandemic.

rejection.details:
The Government announced £310 million of funding to tackle homelessness, to build on the ongoing ‘Everyone In’ campaign. You can find out more here:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-pledges-further-310-million-to-tackle-homelessness

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Fund increased support the homeless: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553237

Require housing for all homeless people after the coronavirus crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/311860

End Homelessness in Britain by adopting and funding the “Housing First” project: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331268
